Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.actor.plane

Class FighterPlane

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
com.example.demo.actor.ActiveActor
com.example.demo.actor.plane.FighterPlane
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
BossPlane, EnemyPlane, MultiPhaseBossPlane, UserPlane
public abstract class FighterPlane extends ActiveActor
The FighterPlane class represents an abstract type of plane that can engage in combat. It extends the ActiveActor class and includes properties and behaviors specific to a fighter plane.

This class includes health management, firing and movement strategies, and provides a template method for updating the plane's state. Subclasses should implement specific behaviors by overriding the performAdditionalUpdates method.

See Also:

    Methods inherited from interface javafx.css.Styleable

    getStyleableNode

  • Field Details

    • health

      protected int health
      The health of the fighter plane. This value represents the current health points of the plane. It is used to determine the plane's survivability in combat.

    • fireRate

      protected final double fireRate
      The rate at which the fighter plane can fire its weapons. This value is a double representing the number of shots per unit time.

    • movementStrategy

      protected MovementStrategy movementStrategy
      The strategy used to determine the movement behavior of the fighter plane. This allows for different movement algorithms to be applied to the plane.

  • Constructor Details

    • FighterPlane

      public FighterPlane(PlaneConfig config)
      Constructs a new FighterPlane with the specified configuration.
      Parameters:
      config - the configuration for the FighterPlane, containing properties such as image name, image height, initial position, health, fire interval, fire rate, firing strategy, and movement strategy.

  • Method Details

    • takeDamage

      public boolean takeDamage()
      Applies damage to the fighter plane by decrementing its health. If the health reaches zero, the plane is destroyed.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in class ActiveActor
      Returns:
      true if the plane is destroyed as a result of the damage, false otherwise.

    • getProjectileXPosition

      public double getProjectileXPosition(double xPositionOffset)
      Calculates the X position of the projectile based on the current layout X position, translation X position, and an additional offset.
      Parameters:
      xPositionOffset - the offset to be added to the current X position
      Returns:
      the calculated X position of the projectile

    • getProjectileYPosition

      public double getProjectileYPosition(double yPositionOffset)
      Calculates the Y position of the projectile based on the current layout Y position, translation Y position, and a given offset.
      Parameters:
      yPositionOffset - the offset to be added to the current Y position
      Returns:
      the calculated Y position of the projectile

    • setMovementStrategy

      public void setMovementStrategy(MovementStrategy movementStrategy)
      Sets the movement strategy for the fighter plane. currently solely used by user planes
      Parameters:
      movementStrategy - the movement strategy to be used by the fighter plane

    • healthAtZero

      public boolean healthAtZero()
      Checks if the health of the fighter plane is at zero or below.
      Returns:
      true if the health is less than or equal to zero, false otherwise.

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Retrieves the current health of the fighter plane.
      Returns:
      the health value of the fighter plane.

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth(int health)
      Sets the health of the fighter plane.
      Parameters:
      health - the new health value to be set

    • update

      public void update(long now)
      Updates the state of the FighterPlane.
      Specified by:
      update in class ActiveActor
      Parameters:
      now - The current time in nanoseconds. This method performs the following actions: 1. If a firing strategy is set and the time since the last fire is greater than or equal to the fire interval, it triggers the firing strategy and updates the last fire time. 2. If a movement strategy is set, it triggers the movement strategy. 3. Calls the performAdditionalUpdates method to handle any additional updates.

    • performAdditionalUpdates

      protected void performAdditionalUpdates(long now)
      Performs additional updates specific to the fighter plane. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses to provide custom update logic. The default implementation does nothing.
      Parameters:
      now - the current time in nanoseconds
